function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Delays in project completion due to lockdown and high-risk personnel","category":"Disruptions from outbreaks and other major external events","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Site engineers and surveyors forced to work from home due to covid-19 lockdown rules","category":"Inadequate remote work setup for employees","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conduct site investigations and health inspections","category":"Inadequate remote work setup for employees","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Delay in infrastructure projects due to covid-19 lockdown restrictions","category":"Disruptions from outbreaks and other major external events","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on construction industry’s supply chains and workforce","category":"Disruptions from outbreaks and other major external events","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for the spread of contagious diseases due to increased infrastructure development and construction activities.","category":"Inadequate adoption of health-focused urban standards","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for community-wide disease transmission due to increased movement and interaction resulting from infrastructure development.","category":"Inadequate adoption of health-focused urban standards","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cross-contamination of medical accessories in factories re-purposed for different products.","category":"Lack of emphasis on air quality ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The construction industry delivering adaptable buildings in record time may lead to a higher risk of disease transmission due to the presence of multiple workers in a confined space.","category":"Insufficient adoption of health-focused building standards","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Refurbishment and renovation activities in the built environment can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if proper hygiene and sanitation measures are not implemented.","category":"Insufficient adoption of health-focused urban standards","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding due to reservation system limitations","category":"Poor urban planning","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of people in cities limiting the ability to travel to alternative sources of supply.","category":"Poor urban planning","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of smart city technologies due to lockdown and reduced city activity.","category":"Disruptions from outbreaks and other major external events","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High cost and technical complexity of transforming existing buildings for pandemic response can limit the feasibility of design interventions.","category":"Insufficient adoption of health-focused building standards","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient space utilization in car parking configurations can impact the ability to repurpose parking spaces for public health needs during pandemics.","category":"Improper architectural designs","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transformation of car parking building to educational spaces may require adaptation of the building envelope for heat exchange control, posing a potential risk of improper ventilation and air circulation.","category":"Improper architectural designs","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variation in illumination standards between car parking buildings and educational spaces poses a challenge in providing adequate lighting for the adapted spaces, increasing the risk of discomfort and potential safety hazards.","category":"Improper architectural designs","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adapting the building envelope for heat exchange control and ventilation in educational spaces may face challenges in maintaining a comfortable indoor environment, especially in extreme climate zones.","category":"Improper architectural designs","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Right-angle parking configuration may lead to inefficient circulation and traffic flow within the adapted spaces, increasing congestion and reducing air quality.","category":"Inadequate urban planning","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High occupancy of built-up areas by car parking spaces","category":"Inadequate urban planning","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate design of pedestrian passages in car parking areas","category":"Inadequate urban planning","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of monitoring in parking areas leading to obstruction of circulation passages","category":"Inadequate urban planning","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of social distancing measures in architectural design","category":"Improper architectural designs","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ultra-dense small cell networks may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases in indoor environments.","category":"Lack of emphasis on air quality ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High data rates for a large number of served users may lead to overcrowding in indoor environments, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Lack of emphasis on air quality ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks and adverse effects of covid-19 on tunnel construction sites","category":"Disruptions from outbreaks and other major external events","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tightly controlled production environment may lead to a false sense of security and neglect of potential risks.","category":"Lack of emphasis on air quality ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Problems with musculoskeletal health due to teleworking conditions","category":"Inadequate remote work setup for employees","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate home workspaces impacting health and productivity","category":"Inadequate remote work setup for employees","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential leakage of exhaust air back into the air supply due to energy recovery ventilation systems.","category":"Infrastructure maintenance risk ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of natural ventilation due to building design, sub-optimal practice, closed windows, and variable wind direction and speed","category":"Lack of emphasis on air quality ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of autonomous robots in the interconnected iomt infrastructure may lead to bias and breach of privacy in collecting samples from infected patients.","category":"Infrastructure maintenance risk ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Regional integration of electronic health records of suspected covid-19 individuals as they travel from one country to the other","category":"Lack of emphasis on water quality ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Malicious attack of iomt healthcare equipment","category":"Infrastructure maintenance risk ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical addresses, street names, and identification cards for contact-persons.","category":"Poor urban planning","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of rt-pcr test kits leading to delays in covid-19 diagnosis","category":"Inadequate adoption of health-focused building standards","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shortage of covid-19 testing kits and detection tools","category":"Inadequate adoption of health-focused building standards","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption of bio-sensors and smart sanitation technology in infrastructure and sanitation products.","category":"Lack of emphasis on water quality ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate wastewater management and treatment","category":"Lack of emphasis on water quality ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relocation of health care personnel hcp to new aiirs","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Pressure differentials not maintained in aiirs","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate negative pressure in patient rooms and anterooms","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance and monitoring of negative air machines","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of infectious particles from isolation rooms into the corridor due to lack of anterooms","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective design and construction of anterooms leading to difficulty in using ppe and disinfecting medical devices","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate size of anterooms leading to insufficient space for health care workers to operate","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate number of aiirs airborne infection isolation rooms for severely affected covid-19 patients","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate room size and equipment for critical covid-19 patients requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, mechanical ventilation, or continuous renal replacement therapy","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of airborne-infection isolation rooms aiirs for covid-19 patients","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for rapid expansion of aiir capacity to prevent infection spread to medical personnel and other patients","category":"Inadequate hospital design ","confidence":"High"}]}
